content: “Go to one of the innumerable mom-and-pop gun shops that doesn’t have to abide by regulations — because there ARE no strict federal regulations.” There’s no such thing as a ‘mom-and-pop’ gun shop. Anybody who sells firearms on a regular basis is required to hold a Federal Firearms License. Even historic gun collectors who sell more than a handful of guns a year are being required to get an FFL. All FFL holders are required to perform background checks on sales of firearms. Although individual sales don’t require a background check, it’s already illegal to knowingly sell a firearm to someone who you suspect isn’t allowed to legally own a firearm, or to anyone who you suspect is buying the firearm for another individual. And you should browse the ATF’s website if you don’t believe there are strict federal regulations — https://www.atf.gov/questions-and-answers/firearms-qas
